review description: The food is better, more refined than when the building housed Stoke's. A little less casual than before, for better or worse. Service is good and the food is as good as most places in San Francisco at a much lower price than you pay in the City. All in all, maybe my new favorite place in the Monterey area.

name: Abalonetti Bar and Grill
review description: One of the best dinning spots in the Monterey area with great food and service

name: Adelina's Bistro
review description: I had the cod which was cooked well. It didn't wow me, especially at that price. My friend had their duck breast, which he liked. He substituted mashed potatoes for the pasta, which worked well for him. The bread had a nice crunchy crust.

name: Alberto's Ristorante (Pacifc Grove)
review description: Excellent food. Everything we had was fantastic. We came with a group of 9 and they accommodated us well. Only thing was that it took a while for us to get our entrees, but they were very polite about it, and kept apologizing for the food taking so long (because they had only 1 cook that day), but once it came out, we were all pleased with the entrees. Very pleasant surprise! A hidden away gem in Pacific Grove.

name: Alcazar
review description: Very overpriced for what was served. The tuna especially was both tiny and bone dry.

name: Andre’s Bouchée Bistro and Wine Bar
review description: We're foodies,but also want everything else-- service and atmosphere. We happwned to be in Carme3 on our anniversary, and chose Andre's based on the reviews, menu, and a walk-by--bingo! It was perfect!

name: Anton & Michel Restaurant
review description: We celebrated our anniversary and had a wonderful meal. The food and service were both excellent. We would highly recommend this restaurant!

name: Apple Farm Restaurant
address: 2015 Monterey Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
review description: I have been there for lunch several times, and this time four of us tried breakfast. The menu has many choices, and they are not just your average bacon and eggs. I had the corned beef Eggs Benedict, and it was outstanding. The corned beef was homemade and delicious, the presentation was excellent. My friend raved about her omelette with smoked salmon, and her husband said the pancakes and apple sausage were very good. Most breakfast are accompanied with your choice of a homemade blueberry or apple streusel muffin, or an English muffin. We all had the homemade muffins, which came with a small cup of warm whole blackberry preserves! Our waiter was very accommodating and met our requests for minor changes graciously. I will go back.

name: Aquarius - Dream Inn
address: 175 West Cliff Drive Santa Cruz, CA  95060
review description: Daniel was our waiter and he was awesome. GREAT VIEW from all seats. Yummy food.

name: Arch Rock Fish
review description: Nice outdoor patio with lots of shading. Also has heat lamps for those cooler days. Food was excellent. We had the calamari appetizer, which was perfect for 2 to share. The salads were delicious, as were our entrees. I highly reccommend the ciopinno, which was generously stocked with lots of seafood (including a small lobster tail)and a delicious broth. Hubby had the lobster roll, which also had generous-sized portion of lobster. we managed to save room for a shared dessert - the ice cream sundae, which was topped with caramelized banana and cashews - a perfect end to a perfect meal. :)

name: Arnoldi's Cafe
review description: I have been to Arnoldi's several times. This night I hope was an exception. The service was very slow and we waited over an hour just to get our food. It appeared they were short staffed but never given an apology and was charged a 20% gratuity since we had a party of 8. We sat outside and once it became cold they turned on heater but they were not working.

name: Artisan
review description: Our wait person was not very attentive. She left us for long periods of time -never checking in on us. The wait for our food was incredibly long and she should have come to give us updates on when our food would be brought out. It was a late reservation so I would have thought that she should come over and asked if we wanted dessert and if it was okay to bring it out even with a member of our party still eating. She didn't and so we didn't have dessert. (We let her know that she missed an opportunity for larger bill -and at tip.) While we were given complementary brownies, it was not the same as enjoying a real dessert.

name: Arts & Letters Cafe
address: 7 East Anapamu Street Santa Barbara, CA  93101
review description: The courtyard dining was charming, and completely shaded. The service was great; the food was great. I highly recommend their pumpkin soup. My only teensy weensy complaint was that they make their sandwiches so tall you can't possibly pick them up and eat them like a sandwich. I had to use my fork. But really, it was so good, I didn't mind at all!

name: Aubergine at L'Auberge Carmel
review description: Dining at Aubergine is enjoyable from beginning to end. The restaurant is comfortable, decor attractive, and the greeting warm. The dining area sits a dozen couples. Dining is by reservations only and seating is immediate upon arrival. The menu has a four course prix fixe with an option wine pairing as well as a chef’s tasting menu. The sommelier is extremely knowledgeable and personable, the wait staff is attentive and helpful, and the executive chief Justin Cogley is phenomenal. Every course is remarkable in presentation, creativity, and taste. The ribeye entre was prepared perfectly and accompanying smoked cherry juice, bay leaf, and amaretto was outstanding. Executive pastry chief Ron Mendoza completes the total experience.

name: Azu
review description: We had a 5:30 reservation and we were seated immediately upon arrival. Excellent service and food.

name: Bahama Island Steakhouse
review description: We went looking for a steakhouse, after so much seafood in California. The steaks were ok, but not great. The fish was also good. the service was a little slow and lacking. We were a group of 8, and to order dessert the waitress gave us 2 dessert menus!!!Also, some of us in the group wanted a expresso coffee after dinner, and they don't have.

name: Baja Cantina - Carmel
address: 7166 Carmel Valley Rd. Carmel Valley, CA  93923
review description: I'm a car guy. Love Thursday nights.....great car stuff collection. Great place to bring friends from out of town.

name: The Ballard Inn
review description: Very nice dining experience, but we had the last seating and the service seemed to disappear as the meal went on. Service was friendly and knowledgeable just inconsistent. It would also be better to have one primary waiter/waitress instead of 4 "helpers". Otherwise the food was very good and well executed and presented.

name: Bella Vista at Four Seasons Resort The Biltmore Santa Barbara
review description: We went for the Thursday night Seafood Buffet. Lobster, oysters, black cod... one of the best buffets I have ever been to.

name: Bistro 1111 at Hyatt Santa Barbara
address: 1111 E. Cabrillo Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93103
review description: A good but relatively unimpressive meal, served on the slow side by under-experienced wait staff, who didn't seem to know Santa Barbara, never mind the menu...

name: Bistro at Bacara Resort
review description: This is one of my all time favorite spots in Santa Barbara. However, since their menu change, the food taste like Denny's. The staff were really great, except the one who was assigned to our table, who kept on giving us attitude about sticking with water -- we had to, due to one of our guest's dietary reasons. I think the restaurant needs to go back to its old days.

name: Blush
review description: Our lunch was an outstanding experience! The food and service could not be better. Between my husband and myself, we had the Poppers, the Chicken Wrap, and the Caprese sandwich, Every bite was delicious! I had the Pineapple Smash cocktail: so yummy! Our waiter, Kyle, gave us first-rate service. We will definitely be returning to repeat this experience.

name: Bouchon - Santa Barbara
address: 9 West Victoria St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
review description: Very nice dinner after the California Wine Festival. Great food and amazing service, the manager was very attentive! Cute little place too!

name: Buona Tavola - Paso Robles
review description: Another great experience! A can't miss restuarant.

name: Buona Tavola - San Luis Obispo
address: 1037 Monterey St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
review description: I had the sea bass. It was overcooked. I like the sides of potatoes, carrot, and spinach. My friend had the chicken breast. He said he liked it.

name: the C restaurant + bar
review description: Loved the food and service! The place is an oasis in a waterfront neighborhood. Calamari is huge and delicious. Gret Cioppino,

name: Cadiz
review description: Great tapas! Wonderful service and great atmosphere.

name: Café Beach Restaurant at Beach Resort Monterey
review description: We had Mother's Day brunch. Food was good. The omelet station and waffle station were awesome! The best part though, was the view! Every seat was a great seat!

name: Cafe Fina
review description: Always a favorite stop. The fresh specials were wonderful this time. Fresh produce from the owners farm paired with the freshest fish.

name: Cafe Mare Italian Restaurant
review description: Cafe Mare is under new ownership. Two of the employees purchased the restaurant and the food is now better than ever! We've eaten there 3 times over the last 2 months a loved it every time. Last night my husband and I had the lasagna special (soon to be on the new menu) and loved it. It had homemade egg noodles and a beautiful bolognese sauce along with bechemel-yum! My niece and her boyfriend, visiting from out of town, had the stuffed chicken and penne pasta alla vodka. The both said their meals were outstanding. Our family loves Italian food and this food tasted like it was made it a small Italian village-fresh, rustic, and great flavors. We are now making this our "go to" place for a great night out. A nice meal for a good price.

name: Cafe Roma
address: 1020 Railroad Ave San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
review description: Very romantic with excellent food.

name: Cannery Row Brewing Company
review description: This is the first bad review I have written. The beer list was really impressive and my group was realy excited to try them. The menu of beers can be overwhelming and it took us a bit to decide. Then the waitress said they were out of the ones we wanted. we again looked at the menu and decided--ordered--again they were out. I wish she would have just listed the ones they had as they were out of most. This was a Tuesday not even a weekend. Then we ordered. The food was bad.The fish and chips was all batter and the little bit of fish inside was not cooked. The best thing on the menu was the soft pretzel!

name: Cantinetta Luca
address: Dolores St. between Ocean and 7th Carmel, CA  93921
review description: We had a fantastic lunch before heading back home. I was bit skeptical as it took a long time for our server to get to us. Seems like he was working all the tables and bar on his own, but once we got our order in, everything was perfect. We were happy and kids were happy. Excellent salumi!

name: Casa Blanca
review description: Food was great. Awesome margarita selection. We sat outside which perfect but inside was very noisy.

name: Casablanca Bistro
review description: Casablanca Bistro was amazing! From the quality of food, to the service, to the view, everything was perfect. It is a great place to celebrate a special occasion.

name: Cava Restaurant
address: 1212 Coast Village Road Santa Barbara, CA  93108
review description: Always a favorite to visit when we are in the area! So glad you are still there!

name: CECCO Ristorante
review description: The food was excellent from the warm bread, to the green lipped mussels and the unique pizza options

name: Chart House Restaurant - Monterey
review description: Been coming to Charthouse since we moved to Monterey ten years ago. One of our "go to" places for family special dinners and to show off our town to guests. Always a great time and food.

name: Christopher's on Lincoln
review description: As Carmel residents, we had not been to Christopher's in quite awhile. Must say that they promote their "local" wines but we did not find many recognizable local wines on the list. They were pushing some wines from Argentina and Chile. They were out of several wines, limiting our choices. Dinner entrees were okay but not great. Salmon was supposed to be local. From the color, it looked like it was farm-raised salmon (local fresh has more color and is in season right now). The BBQ short rib should have been cooked to falling off the bone. Mashed potatoes were very ordinary. We shared a salad, a bottle of local chardonnay, and each had an entree. With a 16% tip it cost us $132. I don't think we will go back; it wasn't worth the price.

name: Cibo Ristorante Italiano
review description: Cibo's is conveniently located on Alvarado street. My husband and I tried it after an early movie at the Osio. The menu was interesting Italian and was good overall.

name: Cielito Restaurant
review description: Santa Barbara is well know for having some terrific Mexican restaurants. Many of them are small store front establishments that serve authentic cuisine often adapted from family or traditional recipes. Cieloto is not one of these. It's located in the middle of downtown SB in a street mall adjacent to many chic shops and eateries. It has an innovative menu and contemporary decor that definitely makes it one of the more upscale Mexican restaurants in town. Unfortunately, the food is inconsistent. It's a great place to eat alfresco in the front courtyard, replete with fountain.

name: Cilantro's - Watsonville
review description: We LOVE Cilantro's....Courtney called us to let us know the server we requested Jeanette was not going to be on for our 5:30 p.m. reservation..what amazing customer service. We of course waited for our favorite server...always a smile, great communication and knows what we like:~)

name: Coast
address: 31 West Carrillo Street Santa Barbara, CA  93101
review description: Beautiful location in a botique hotel. The chicken tortilla soup was excellant. My husband had the special halibut and said it was very light and flavorful. My pork ribs were tender and yummy. We will return next time we are in Santa Barbara.

name: Colby Jack's
review description: I knew Colby Jack's was a local hot spot from my friend's reviews, but had never had a chance to visit. My husband and I went for our anniversary and were NOT dissapointed! The food was excellent, the service outstanding, and the prices very reasonable. We will visit again.

name: Domenico's on the Wharf
review description: Don't let the pushy woman outside the restaurant scare you away. The views are great (make a reservation so you can sit by the window to watch the pelicans and the seals) and the food is fresh and very well prepared. Family friendly but the noise level is slightly louder.

name: Downey's
review description: This a fantastic restaurant to take someone who you want to impress and it is always consistent!

name: Edgar's - Quail Lodge
review description: Friendly staff and excellent food. The food was noteworthy. We were a bit over dressed as it has a bit of a casual "golfing" ambiance, almost like a nice sports bar/restaurant.

name: El Palomar - Santa Cruz
review description: Charming building, a little dark for a spring evening. Lots of young people and energy. Good food and lots of it. But everything suffers dramatically because it is just TOO D--- LOUD! We had to lean across the table in order to have a conversation. We have no idea what the specials were even though we asked the waitress to repeat them.Rowdy NOT romantic.

name: Enterprise Fish Co. - Santa Barbara
review description: Service was a little slow, food was presented well and tasty.

name: Epsilon
review description: Such a welcome surprise. Food and service were fantastic. We will definitely be back!

name: F. McLintocks Saloon & Dining House
review description: Great food, a bit spendy but great food.

name: Fandango
review description: Really like the ambiance and atmosphere of this warm, quaint, and "homey" restaurant. A lot of seafood, meat, and pasta specials to accompany their diverse menu. While our entrees were tasty, I would not rate the food as excellent. Overall, it's a nice, relaxed dining experience if not a bit overpriced.

name: Far Western Tavern
review description: we have always enjoyed dining at the Far Western Tavern, and introduced other friends to the establishment; everyone enjoyed themselves and the food was great, as usual, but this time there was a surprise since a new chef was in place; the tavern will be moving to Orcutt and there are some elements that are in progress/change; still, it was and is a great place for special events, and dinner enjoyment; we will continue to visit this fine establishment....

name: Fish Hopper
review description: I was a bit skeptical at first but the food turned me around! Fabulous fish dishes. Try to get a table near the window. Service wasattentive and friendly.

name: Flaherty's Seafood Grill & Oyster Bar
address: On 6th Avenue between Dolores & San Carlos Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA  93921
review description: Service was excellent, they were attentive and "watched out" for us the entire meal.

name: Gardens of Avila Restaurant
address: 1215 Avila Beach Dr. San Luis Obispo, CA  93405
review description: Very fresh seafood and farm fresh sides. The quality is tasted in the meal and the love and expertise of the chef. etc. Service was excellent. Looking forward to revisiting soon. A real gem in the San Louis/Avila/Pismo area.

name: Gennaro's Grill & Garden
address: 450 Marsh Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
review description: The Ciopinno was very good. The Oso Bucco was good but could use something other than saffron rice with the dish. That made it too heavy overall. Waitor described a crab soup as a special. I expected some crab in it but it was just all liquid. Maybe I did fully understand the description.

name: Gilbert's Red Snapper
review description: We had a nice time at Gilbert's. It's right on the warf with tons of tourists (we were tourists too), so it was crowded, but the restaurant was fun. The prices were great which is what we were looking for, but still something where we could sit down and enjoy the view of the marina.

name: Granada Bistro
address: 1126 Morro St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
review description: Great spot for tapas and drinks. I would of given it a five had it not been undergoing construction.

name: Grasing's
address: NW Corner of 6th & Mission Ave. Carmel, CA  93921
review description: We were expecting more given the reviews. We weren't wowed by anything, except the wine list, which one might expect given the location. We found it too noisy to considered romantic. Again, there was nothing particularly wrong with the food, service, ambiance, etc., but we found nothing "special" about it either. I wish I could be more specific, but maybe I can't because the dining experience left so little impression. Oh, by the way, the 2008 Raptor Ridge Res Pinot (yes, I order Oregon Pinot in Cali Pinot country) was fantastic.

name: Harbor Restaurant
review description: A great menu! It was SOOO difficult to make a selection! That NEVER happens to me!! And the food was absolutely amazing. From the oysters on the half shell, to the shrimp cocktail, to the filet mignon with the most decadent Cabernet Souvignon glaze! Out of this world! Unfortunately, the servers were extremely inattentive and appeared inexperienced. This restaurant is doing itself a disservice by hiring inexperienced kids and trying to pass them off as servers in what would otherwise be an amazing fine dining establishment. Seating a party of 2 next to a large, noisy dinner party is definitely a rookie move. Hiring kids might be a good idea for summer camp, but not for a fine dining restaurant. The experience suffered because of it

name: Hitching Post II
review description: Front staff very friendly, reservations were honored right on time. On a prior visit in April, I had the prime flat iron that was very good. Based on our previous experience, we ordered the flat iron again, but this time it was a great disappointment. There seemed to be gristle in every bite making it difficult to chew. We will rethink our choice of restaurants the next time we pass this way.

name: Hoffman's Bistro
review description: We were meeting for a book club. We sat outside, as there was live music inside. Our food was good, but the service was slow. It was understandable because the restaurant was really full. It was very pleasant, and not cold by the time we left at 8:30pm.

name: The Hungry Cat - Santa Barbara
review description: The service was excellent and extremely accommodating. I ordered the white sea bass, which was a bit on the dry side, but the dish accompaniments (white bean puree, I think) were excellent. The seafood platter came with good dipping sauces, although it was overall on the pricey side for what we received. The two tier was a small appetizer for 6 ppl at $90. I'd give the place another try, but next time will skip the platter.

name: Il Cortile Ristorante
review description: We enjoyed a delicious dinner 7/17/12. Service was excellent and server was knowledgeable. The calamari, shrimp and scallop appetizer was tender and cooked perfectly. Salad with mixed greens, strawberries, ricotta and candied pecans was fresh and dressing very good. Veal chop with mushrooms was cooked perfectly. Freshly made papparadelle with cinghiale was as good as those I've had in Italy. Lemon tart was the perfect end. Excellent wine list.

name: Il Fornaio - Carmel
address: Ocean Avenue & Monte Verde St Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA  93921
review description: Dinner with family. Food was delicious. Service most accommodating.

name: Jacks - Portola Hotel & Spa
review description: We had the breakfast buffet, and I highly recommend the made-to-order waffles and pancakes. The best I'd ever had, and I don't even care for pancakes. The omelette station was very nice, with good and fresh ingredients, and the chef is super sweet. The servers were all very attentive. Definitely good for a special event.

name: Joe Rombi's La Mia Cucina
review description: What a fabulous place to have dinner. Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the Warf area, Joe Rombi's is a breath of fresh air. The cozy intimate atmosphere makes you feel right at home. The service was fantastic, as the server and server's assistant pay attention to your every detail. Dinner was fantastic as everyone was very pleased with their plates. I would strongly recommend Joe Rombi's to anyone that is looking to celebrate a special ocassion, or quiet romantic dinner.

name: Johnny's Harborside
review description: Johhny's Harborside is my favorite restaurant when going to the Santa Cruz Harbor. Wonderful view and marvelous food.

name: Kula Ranch Island Steakhouse
review description: The bar food is excellent! Try the pulled pork and Angus beef sliders!

name: la Posta
review description: La Posta consistently serves up some of the best food in Santa Cruz. Although the menu is not terribly long, the choices are always interesting and feature local ingredients prepared by an expert hand. Our party of four enjoyed one of their incredible thin crust pizzas as an appetizer, which was out of this world. (A great bottle of Italian wine as an accompaniment didn't hurt!) Two of us had one of their house-made pastas--a triangular shaped ravioli that melted in your mouth. I had the tri tip and my dining partner the ling cod. We all cleaned our plates. We split desserts, fresh peach sorbet and a lemon pound cake with lemon verbena gelato. Delicious! I highly recommend La Posta for a fine dining experience in a casual setting.

name: Laili
review description: Great little restaurant that sparkles at night when sitting outside. The inside feels a little cave like, but perhaps that's just because the outside is such a warm and sweet area filled with quiet ambiance. Food is very good with some less familiar spices, vegetables, and ways of cooking both meat and vegetables. Nice selection of vegetarian choices. Unusual and delightful non alcoholic drinks.

name: Le Cigare Volant
review description: Fascinating food in minimal portions and totally over priced. But we were hungry when we left after $120 for 2. Great wine list. Creative treatment for a warehouse type building, but in the end the dining area is lackluster. Industrial.

name: Le St. Tropez
address: Dolores St. between Ocean & 7th Avenue Carmel-By-The-Sea, CA  93921
review description: Wonderful complimentary appetizer: bowl of hummus, 20 tiny olives, 5 wedges of beets, slices of squash!

name: Lido Restaurant @ Dolphin Bay Resort & Spa
address: 2727 Shell Beach Road Pismo Beach, CA  93449
review description: The service was amazing as well as the food. I love this place! Will be back. The staff was courtious.

name: Lodge Restaurant at Carmel Valley Ranch
review description: We were very pleased with the restaurant. The quality/price proposition is very compelling. The food was very good. Wines were good but not over priced. The ambiance was energetic, full of life, lots of action, nice architecture and good views. And the service was superb. What's not to like. We will be repeaters for sure. Highly recommended.

name: Lopez Restaurante y Cantina
review description: OK Mexican food, but nothing to write home about. The hostess was clueless about OpenTable, so the reservation was pointless. Fortunately, they had room for us. The dining room was dark and windowless; the fajitas ordered by a large group smoked up the whole room: there was poor air circulation. The server was friendly.

name: Los Olivos Wine Merchant & Cafe
review description: Very good food. Fine service; our waitress was very personable and helpful.

name: Louie’s Cajun Kitchen and Bourbon Bar
review description: The food was delicious. we were there on a Tuesday night and it was pretty quiet sans for a few tables, and some guys watching sports at the bar. Large drink list (I got a delicious cucumber cocktail). The waiter allowed my aunt to add fish to the portabella mushroom dish and modified it to make it even more delicious. I had swordfish that was flavored and cooked perfectly. If you are looking for a nicer meal in a more casual town like Santa Cruz, this is a great place!

name: Lucky's
address: 1279 Coast Village Road Santa Barbara, CA  93108
review description: WE loved the place, the food was exceptionally good from the salad, to the staeak and potatoes and vegetables to the dessert.The service was extremely good. The whole experience was wonderful. One of our best dining experiences.

name: Lugano Swiss Bistro
review description: We celebrated our 18th wedding anniversary by having the four course fondue dinner. The service was excellent. We were seated in a semi-private enclave with a Happy Anniversary banner. The bread, salad, veggies, chicken, beef, and dessert were all very good. There was so much food to enjoy! And the ice cold Spaten made everything taste better.

name: Luna Red
address: 1023 Chorro Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
review description: The people I went with knew the chef, so we gave him a budget and dietary restrictions, and he gave us an inspired and inspiring meal. The waitress had fun with it too. Absolutely top-notch!

name: Madonna Inn - Alex Madonna's Gold Rush Steak House
address: 100 Madonna Road San Luis Obispo, CA  93405
review description: Excellent steaks, done perfectly. Sides and salads basic fare, not innovative. Service spot on, but not intrusive. Wine list has modest selection of different varietals, with emphasis on Central Coast wineries. Decor is over the top Alex Madonna (check out the website for the Madonna story), but makes for a fun evening. All seating is booths, private and quiet.

name: Main Street Garden & Cafe
review description: Sardines were impressive. The ambience is unique being that it is a converted house. Guests must be patient because it has a very laid back neighborhood speed to the service. Be friendly, smile and just take it all in. Food was impressive.

name: Mama's Meatball
address: 570 Higuera St. Suite 130 San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
review description: We are always delighted when we eat at Mama's Meatballs. The service was great and the food was excellent, as always.

name: Maravilla - Ojai Valley Inn & Spa
review description: First courses were lovely. Never miss the heirloom tomatoes grown on property. The main courses were not up to the same standard. The black cod while perfectly cooked, needed some seasoning. The NY steak was over cooked and lacked any seasoning. Desserts are exquisite, not so much the coffee (decaf was burned and appeared to have spent too much time in pot). The service was spot on.

name: Marinus - Bernardus Lodge
address: 415 West Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924
review description: Everything but the service was great!! Our waiter was very slow and inattentive. He seemed to be more interested in going home than doing his job. 25 minutes before closing the couple who were seated next to us were told to hurry up and give him their order as the kitchen was about to close!!!!! We have been to this restaurant many times as it is very close to our vacation home in Carmel Valley. In the past it has always been excellent in all areas.

name: Marisol at the Cliffs Resort
address: 2757 Shell Beach Rd Pismo Beach, CA  93449
review description: Don't know about the rest of our group, although no one did much bragging about the food. My dinner was hit and miss -- worst salad ever (BLT), fish way overcooked and bland. Side dishes and desserts were very good. Overall, a disappointment as I expected more.

name: Marmalade Cafe - Santa Barbara
review description: I had a reservation for 7 for our department at work. We were very tight on time, so I decided to have everyone leave early for our lunch arrival. I had the advantage to call in our orders at 10AM and I was greeting warmly to that idea. Needless to say we had our meal shortly after we sat down and had 30 min to chat and travel back to the office.

name: MexItalian
review description: Unusual fusion of Mexican & Italian cuisine. The dishes were very good, having a number of the smaller plates in order to sample, could not get enough. Menus was extensive, all fresh ingredients. The calamari & chorizo pizza were just two that were fabulous, must visit & experience.

name: Michael's on Main
review description: I had forgotten about this place. It is tucked away. The light menu here is a brilliant idea. Less food, the serving size a normal person should eat, for less money.

name: Milk 'n Honey
review description: We've been coming in for a few years and have never been disappointed. The only reason we don't come more often is because we'd order everything. We always find something new to try and have loved each discovery.

name: Miro at Bacara Resort
review description: The experience was memorable. Great service, gourmet food, beautiful ambiance...however, for us this was a special occasion, worth the price tag that was somewhat above our dining out norm for a routine Saturday night out dinner...at least for us.

name: Montecito Wine Bistro
review description: Upon arriving, the host did not know our reservation was made through Open Table. Clearly they had not looked at it because tables in the area where we requested seating were not set. We were led there anyway, then sat and waited for several minutes before any staff approached. We finally got up and retrieved menus from another table. The waitress was inattentive and unprofessional. The appetizer of veggie fries was good. The Caprese salad and Caesar salad were good but VERY overpriced. The gnocchi was much too heavy and the pasta with meatballs was not good. We've tasted more interesting tomato sauce out of a jar and the meatballs were dry as a bone. We didn't even bother staying for coffee and dessert, and won't be going back. Too bad!

name: Montrio Bistro
review description: Great food and service easy to see why they were voted best restaurant in Monterey for last ten years. I had the Alaskan Halibut. The chef really knows how to do fish it was perfect.

name: Novo Restaurant
address: 726 Higuera Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
review description: I had the salmon salad. I enjoyed everything in the salad and that it was a light dish. My friend had the duck mole. He really enjoyed the duck and mole, but wasn't impressed with what accompanied it.

name: Oak Tree Ristorante
review description: Wonderful service despite a large fundraising event outside.

name: Old Fisherman's Grotto
review description: Service was fantastic - we had no problem changing our reservation and they held the table for us. While we were looking over the menu they brought over a complementary appetizer. Food was very good and they had some of the best Bloody Marys I've ever had.

name: Oswald
review description: Oswald was amazing. We were early and they promptly sat us for dinner. Super friendly server, who knew what she was doing when it came to recommending a great wine for dinner, even letting me sample from between two wines. The food was delicious and cooked perfectly.

name: Pacific's Edge Restaurant
review description: The food was excellent and the view was spectacular.

name: Panolivo
review description: We always went in for their fabulous vegie/vegan dish. It is now gone and so are we! The food is generally very tasty and the piece is reasonable.

name: Paradise Beach Grille
review description: We booked through Open Table and had to wait for about 15 mins to be seated because our table wasn't ready. The service was painfully slow. The food was ok, but the mashed potatoes tasted like it had waited too long under the heating lights or maybe reheated. It was a bit disappointing as it was recommended to me as one of the best restaurants in Capitola.

name: Passionfish
review description: The food was delicious and our server was very helpful in making a wine recommendation. Loved that their wines are priced at almost retail and that they have an extensive selection. We had the oysters (best ones we had during our weekend in Norcal) and mussels (a bit small but the broth was great) to start, followed by the halibut and scallops. Overall great experience.

name: Pearl of the Ocean
review description: I was disappointed in the service this time. It took so much time to even get a glass of water. I'm not sure why, but it seemed we were just a bother to them. I wondered if they were just angry that we used OpenTable to make the reservation.

name: Peter B's Brewpub
review description: I love the relaxed feel of this place. Service is always well-timed and friendly! Recommend Peter Be's Brewpub...

name: Pino Alto Restaurant - Cabrillo College
review description: Our party of five had a wonderful time at the Pino Alto Restaurant. The entire staff that we met was wonderful and we enjoyed the food very much. I have already recommended it to friends.

name: The Restaurant at JUSTIN Vineyards & Winery
review description: Excellent food, great atmosphere, superior service.

name: The Restaurant at Ventana
review description: It was a wonderful meal and setting. Great for my vegetarian wife, they had a full veggie tasting menu, well considered and delicious. Plus the space is wonderful with big windows looking to the sea and mountains. Great option in Big Sur.

name: Rio Grill
review description: It would take up to much space to describe the mess that is this restaurant, but in summary.Atmosphere: cartoons on the wall as you enter near the bar area, then trying to be more upscale and elegant at the tables. Pick a concept/direction and go with itService Staff: unknowledgeable, not very friendly, food stains on their attire, didn’t even know there was specials until we left the restaurant and saw them on the board, etc..Food: horrendous menu concept, presentation/plating of the food was bad and unprofessional, and the food itself was completely tasteless.

name: Robin's
review description: Lovely restaurant with great menu choices. We had a lovely brunch there this morning...highly recommended!!

name: Rocky Point Restaurant
review description: A great venue for lunch. The view is outstanding! Service was friendly and attentive and food was good.

name: Root 246 at Hotel Corque
review description: Great restaurant. Excellent food. Bar area was cozy with fireplace.

name: Rosie McCann's Irish Pub & Restaurant
review description: Great bar with excellent selection of beers. Free range grass-fed beef cooked exactly as ordered.

name: Roy
address: 7 W. Carrillo St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
review description: One of our favorite places in Santa Barbara - my daughter requested to have her 18th birthday dinner there. We particularly enjoy the soups which are always excellent.

name: Sandbar Mexican Restaurant
review description: The food and service was very good. A very nice night with lots of activity. We will definately return on our next visit.

name: Sanderlings - Seascape Resort
review description: Beautiful view on a warm clear day made up for slowish food delivery.

name: Sardine Factory
review description: Food and service were great. Ambiance was a cross between a Victorian bordello and Disney' haunted mansion

name: Schooners Coastal Kitchen & Bar – Monterey Plaza Hotel & Spa
review description: Restaurant was very nice. Beautiful view. Food was excellent.

name: Sea Venture
address: 100 Ocean View Ave. Pismo Beach, CA  93449
review description: We had a wonderful warm shrimp and mixed green salad that was excellent. The wine, Opolo Mountain Zinfandel, is the best! The steak and lobster, not so much. The lobster was good, but slightly overcooked. The steak (a filet, which is my favorite cut) was tasteless and way overcooked. I won’t order a steak there again. The crème brûlée was excellent. I wish the bar was further away from the dining room though. The bar noise is too loud to enjoy a nice, relaxing dinner.

name: Seagrass Restaurant
address: 30 E. Ortega St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
review description: The outdoor seating is right next to the street and not very pleasant, but once we moved inside, the food, service and ambiance were all wonderful. It's pricey, so I consider it to be a special occasion restaurant, but it was lovely. Note, however, that the menu is somewhat limited and not very vegetarian friendly. Everything we ate, however, was delicious.

name: Shadowbrook Restaurant Capitola
review description: i've been here once before and i thought it was a wonderful place so i decided to take my girlfriend here for the first time and made some reservations online beforehand. i get there on time and end up waiting nearly 30 minutes to be seated. i understand that when it's full and people stay longer its difficult to reserve a table. but what's the point of a reservation if these accommodations can't be met with reasonable time? To top it off we got sat in that little corner table that to me, seemed like the neglected corner table. no view and just crammed in next to the fireplace. we ended up getting moved to a better table so it made things better. But overall, pretty good food and great ambiance. Just work on the reservation timing part.

name: Sides Hardware and Shoes - A Brothers Restaurant
address: 2375 Alamo Pintado Avenue Los Olivos, CA  93441
review description: Mattei Brothers are alive and well at this new site. Previously Patrick's Sidestreet Cafe--the restaurant is charming--the food is wonderful.......

name: Sierra Mar - Post Ranch Inn
review description: ice you can afford $110 prix fixe 4 course meal plus wine plus tax and tip, you,ll love the gorgeous scenery, excellent food and service. A less dramatic, but truly gorgeous alternative with outside seating was the Ventan Inn and Spa on the east side of Hwy 1 way up in the hills overlooking the coast.

name: Sly's
review description: Best nice place in entire Central Coast. Traditional fare with lots of twists. My friends all wanted a lighter meal and each LOVED their salads! Can't beat the steaks and pasta.

name: Soif Wine Bar Restaurant
review description: Gnocchi light and tasty. Grilled peaches -- excellent. Small menu, great choices.

name: State Street Wine Bistro
review description: Great food,great location. Very pleasant atmosphere.

name: Steamers of Pismo
review description: It was very enjoyable, we brought our Sister for her 70th birthday and were very pleased. We also ate there for our anniversary in April for dinner and it was wonderful too.

name: Stonehouse at San Ysidro Ranch
address: 900 San Ysidro Lane Santa Barbara, CA  93108
review description: The service team was great and in an excellent setting. The food was underwhelming particularly the Halibut. Would not visit again and this has been on our special occasion list for several years.

name: Suzanne's Cuisine
review description: We came to Suzanne's to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We were seated promptly when we arrived. Our table was on the edge of the restaurant overlooking the beautiful garden. We enjoyed the Limoncello pom martini and St. Germaine gimlet over a shared crab corn cake appetizer. The crab cake was awesome. Big on crab, not fillers. We split the pear spinach salad. This salad was very tasty and refreshing. This salad was generous and our server was correct in recommending we split it (especially since we had the appetizer). I had the grilled golden trout and my husband had the salmon. Both dishes were amazing with great flavor. For dessert we split the Cafe Liegoise desert which was incredible. The staff was warm and attentive.

name: Tarpy's Roadhouse
review description: I ordered the swordfish and I thought it was dry with seasonings I didn't care for. I had my husband taste it and we called the waitress over. She took the plate to the chef and came back and told us that they were removing it from the menu because it smelled strong. They didn't charge us for the meal. Overall it was a good experience and we would go back there again.My husband had the salmon and it was very good!

name: Taste Cafe & Bistro
review description: I had the sand dab special, that came with a soup or salad. I chose the caesar salad. The salad and the entree wasn't anything I would want to order again. Nothing special. My friend liked his lamb dish.

name: Thomas Hill Organics
review description: We went to dinner at Thomas Hill Organics for my husbands birthday and they more than impressed. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. He did not hesitate to pick the perfect glass of wine to pair with our meals. I ordered the day boat sea scallops and my husband ordered the hanger steak. Both were excellent, with the exception that my husband ordered his steak cooked medium well, which made the steak a little less than perfect. At the end they presented my husband a absolutely scrumptious brownie with vanilla bean ice cream and caramel for his birthday. My husband enjoyed every moment. We will be back.

name: Trattoria Grappolo
review description: food was excellant, service was excellant, tables are close together, noisey, hard to have a conversation.

name: Trattoria Mollie
address: 1250 Coast Village Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93108
review description: Terrific restaurant. Some of the best food we ever tasted. Great staff and Mollie her self comes out from the kitchen to make you feel comfortable and often will give one a free dessert or starter. A must to go to while in Santa Barbara/Montecito.

name: Tre Lune
address: 1151 Coast Village Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93108
review description: This was my second time at Tre Lune. Both times the food and service have been awesome. Thank you Louis. My husband is a picky eater and they worked with us to provide him with an excellent meal.

name: TusCA Ristorante
address: 1 Old Golf Course Road Monterey, CA  93940
review description: It was just okay. Good hotel restaurant. I would not seek them out for any occasion. Food just okay. It was surprisingly pricey.

name: Vieni Vai Trattoria
address: 690 Higuera St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
review description: Food and service both just so-so. Fried Calamari for appetizer; portion size was WAY too small for the price. Ordered 2 glasses of wine, one was maybe a 6 oz pour and other was more like 4 oz. Way too much stuff on the menu (almost always never a good sign at a restaurant). Lasagne and pizza were good; spaghetti puttanesca was ok (not bad but not great either); veal scallopini was literally inedible and a very small portion for the price, probably one of the worst things I've ever tasted in a restaurant. Sides were very mediocre - small salad with gelatinous Italian dressing, very small portion of veggies and pasta with veal. Waitress was scattered, lasagne arrived 10 mins after rest of food. Should have had a better experience for $100.

name: Villa Creek Restaurant
review description: Hot Spot in the truest sence of the word... 84 degrees INSIDE. Excuse was because of high ceilings... ummmm, heat rises. Then manager would adjust A/C... I was sitting across from thermostat which was never touched BUT I could read the numbers... now 86!!! Oh, then was told it was because of the heat outside... it was 84. Stear clear unless you like dining in a sauna. Too bad because the food was good and seems like a nice place, maybe a winter find.

name: The Whaling Station
review description: wonderful dinner. Service was excellent.

name: Wickets Bistro - Bernardus Lodge
address: 415 Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924
review description: Great lunch outside - lovely setting!

name: Willows at Chumash Casino
review description: Pricey for what we got. Limited menu.

name: Wills Fargo
address: 19 East Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924-9703
review description: Great find! Dinner and wine were only outdone, by the knowlege and engaging staff. We had dinner at Wills Fargo and found it to be a lovely room, great staff and fabulous food. The salads were crisp and fresh and our main courses were prepared perfectly. My wife, son (15) and daughter (12) and I loved the entire experience.

name: Wine Cask - Santa Barbara
review description: Beautiful room in a historic building. Food was well executed but some plate combinations like salmon on top of grains with melon balls was not cohesive and left me missing something. Desserts were incredible. If only main courses could have been so lovely
